item.title: Report X-2025010125
item.description:
Report X-2025010125

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND ACTING ACCORDINGLY THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE DOUBLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK WAS A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE CONTAINERS. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN PROCESSED FURTHER ACCORDING TO THE DMP WASTE DISPOSAL FLOW CHART.

item.title: Report E-2025010018
item.description:
Report E-2025010018

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twenty (20) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the skid shifting during transport causing the drum to crack. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material. The granular materials, cardboard, and product were containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Another 55-gallon drum was used to containerize the damaged drum and left over product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
